trans-unit.source: kreXX is a feature rich php debugger with a neatly arranged debug window, featuring backend access to logfiles, code generation to reach the displayed values and much more.
Shall kreXX try to analyse the protected properties of a class? This may result in a lot of output.
Shall kreXX try to analyse the private properties of a class? This may result in a lot of output.
Shall kreXX do a deep analysis for scalar types? We are handling XML, JSON, callbacks and filepath.
Shall kreXX try to analyse possible traversable data?

Comma-separated list of used debug callback functions. A lot of frameworks offer these, toArray and toString being the most common. kreXX will try to call them, if they are available and display their provided data.
Most frameworks have objects inside of objects inside of objects, and so on. Normally kreXX does not run in circles, but going to deep inside of an object tree can result in a lot of output.

'Browser shutdown phase' = Sending everything to the browser after TYPO3 is finished with everything. 'File' = Saving everything to the log folder. 'Browser immediately' = Sending everything to the browser right away.

kreXX has no problem with creating 1 GB of output, your browser can certainly not handle this much HTML. When using kreXX in a loop, it will create output every time the loop is executed. To limit this, you can configure the maximum call settings.
Here you can disable kreXX without uninstalling the whole extension.
How many logfiles do you want to store inside your logging folder? When there are more files than this number, the older files will get deleted.
Choose a skin here. We have provided kreXX with two skins: smoky-grey and hans.

A backtrace tends to produce a lot of output, and browsers tend to have problems with more than 100MB output in HTML text. Normally it is not necessary to go back more than 10 steps, but if you need to, you can increase this number here.

kreXX tries to detect whether a request is made via AJAX. When it is detected, it will not send any output to the browser at all, because an AJAX request hat most certainly no way of displaying the kreXX output. Logging is still possible of course. The AJAX detection can be disabled here.
kreXX checks regularly how much memory is left. Here you can adjust the amount where it will trigger an emergency break. Unit of measurement is MB.
kreXX checks during the analysis how much time has elapsed since start. Here you can adjust the amount where it will trigger an emergency break. Unit of measurement is seconds.
Here you can toggle if kreXX shall analyse the protected methods of a class.
Here you can toggle if kreXX shall analyse the private methods of a class.
List of IPs that can trigger kreXX. Wildcards can be used.
Shall kreXX try to determine the output of getter methods? These methods will not be called. kreXX will try to get the (possible) result from the class properties, which may lead to false results.

When encountering an array larger than this number, kreXX will resort to a simplified array analysis. This means that classes or other arrays in this large array will only get a rudimentary analysis to prevent an overkill output.
Use kreXX as the TYPO3 log file writer?
There are different log levels. Depending on the setting, you may get a lot of output.
The language key from the help file(s). We provide kreXX in two language english as a fallback, and german.
kreXX will function normally, but please do not debug a productive system.
Wrong configuration for: '%s => %s'! Expected boolean. The configured setting was not applied!
Wrong configuration for: '%s => %s'! Expected integer. The configured setting was not applied!
Wrong configuration for: 'output => destination'! Expected 'browser', 'file' or 'browserImmediately'. The configured setting was not applied!
Wrong configuration for: 'output => skin'! Skin not found. The configured setting was not applied!
Could not read the Local Cookie configuration. Sorry :-/
Wrong configuration for: 'output => iprange'! An empty IP list means that no one will be able to use kreXX. The configured setting was not applied!
Wrong configuration for: 'runtime => maxRuntime'! Maximum for this server is: %s. The configured setting was not applied!
Maximum call-level reached. This is the last analysis for this request. To increase this value, please edit: emergency => maxCall.
Wrong configuration for: '%s => %s'! The debugmethod '%s' is blacklisted. The configured setting was not applied!
Wrong configuration for: '%s => %s'! '%s' is not a valid method. The configured setting was not applied!
Wrong configuration for: 'TYPO3 => activateT3FileWriter'! '%s' is not a valid logging level. The configured setting was not applied!
Emergency break due to extensive run time!
Emergency break due to extensive memory usage!
Chunksfolder %s is not writable! This will increase the memory usage of kreXX significantly!
The PHP extension 'fileinfo' is not installed. The mime type analysis is not available.
The php extension 'mb-string' is not installed. The string analysis may be unreliable.
Wrong configuration for: '%s => %s'! The language '%s' is not available. The configured setting was not applied!
List of debug methods to poll for data:
Maximum nesting level for objects and arrays:
Maximum array size before fallback to simplified analysis:
Here you can edit the frontend configuration form.
= The value can be edited in the frontend.
= The value will only be displayed. kreXX will not accept any value for it.
= kreXX will not display the value or accept any values for it.
This setting is not editable on the frontend.
kreXX will be called in the PHP source code:
Most of the time you will use this method. kreXX will analyse the $object and give you detailed information about it:
Protected properties of the object (can be toggled)
Private properties of the object (can be toggled)
Content of the traversable part of the object (can be toggled)
Result of all configured debugging methods (can be configured)
In case the variable is not an object, it will simply display its content.
Define a "moment" during a benchmark test. The $string should be something meaningful, like "Model invoice db call":
End the benchmark test and displays the result:
Outputs backtrace with sourcecode. When kreXX finds objects inside the backtrace, it will analyse them:
Calling the ViewHelper is pretty much straight forward.
Use this part if you don't want fluid to escape your string or if you are stitching together an array.
kreXX measures the time between every call, and then outputs it as a benchmark.
Sorry, there are currently no logfiles.
Error while parsing the server answer.
